Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; ENGOBE
Name: Vase
Description: Ovoid vase with barely defined small flat base. The neck is emphasised by a convex swell. The lip is flared and triangular. The vessel was covered with a polished orange slip on to which a decorative motif was painted in red-brown: a hatched band on the shoulder and a motif that resembles a fish.
